entry.title: Featured Travel Topic
entry.content:
Featured Travel Topic

Dehydration

A condition that may affect travellers in many places and for many reasons. Never pleasant, sometimes fatal.

entry.title: Off the Beaten Path
entry.content:
Off the Beaten Path

El Cuyo

El Cuyo beckons to visitors looking for a quiet, natural seaside town to bask in the sun undisturbed by revelers while other visitors seek adrenaline-pumping excitement.

entry.title: Destination of the Month
entry.content:
Destination of the Month

Kowloon

One of the most densely populated cities on Earth, Hong Kong's mainland portion offers a culture less influenced by the British than the neighboring Island, plus accommodation, dining, and nightlife are generally cheaper.

entry.title: The Little Hours

entry.content: ... that Li Xinchuan was allowed to return to his old workplace after fleeing the Mongol invasion?

entry.title: Variations on a Theme from La Cenerentola
entry.content: ... that the Variations on a Theme from La Cenerentola are attributed to Frédéric Chopin, but he may only have composed one of the variations?

entry.title: Suprapto Martosetomo
entry.content: ... that Suprapto Martosetomo sheltered Indonesian students at his residence in the Philippines during a 1989 coup attempt?

entry.title: Eurovision Song Contest 1961
entry.content: ... that Lale Andersen, who was popular with both sides of World War II for her version of "Lili Marleen", represented Germany in the Eurovision Song Contest 1961?

entry.title: J. Harry Benrimo
entry.content: ... that actor and playwright J. Harry Benrimo has been described as a "central and versatile figure in Orientalist theater"?

entry.title: fluier
entry.content: ... that a type of flute known as a fluier was sometimes built into Romanian shepherds' whips and staffs?

entry.title: Bill Cottrell
entry.content: ... that Bill Cottrell went from playing for a high-school team that had 32 consecutive losses to starting for an NFL team?

entry.title: seven-spot ladybirds
entry.content: ... that an estimated 23 billion seven-spot ladybirds (example pictured) swarmed England's eastern and southern coasts during a heatwave in 1976?
